wikipedia_page.main: John Fowler (b. Bristol, England, 1537; d. Namur, present-day Belgium, 13 Feb., 1578-9) was a Catholic scholar and printer.

response: * John Fowler (Catholic scholar) (1537–1578/9), Catholic scholar and printer
* John Fowler (politician) (1756–1840), U.S. Congressman from Kentucky
* Sir John Fowler, 1st Baronet (1817–1898), British railway engineer
* John Fowler (agricultural engineer) (1826–1864), English pioneer in the use of steam engines for ploughing
* John Fowler (footballer, born 1933) (1933–1976), Scottish footballer with Colchester United
* John Fowler (mayor) (born 1954), mayor of the City of South Sydney
* John Fowler & Co., a British engineering company
* Sir John Fowler Leece Brunner, 2nd Baronet (1865–1929), British politician

link_mentions.page: A Dialogue of Comfort against Tribulation
response: * A dialogue of cumfort against tribulation, made by the right vertuous, wise and learned man, Sir Thomas More, sometime L. Chanceller of England, which he wrote in the Tower of London, An. 1534. and entituled thus: a dialogue of cumfort against tribulation, made by an Hungarian in Latin, and translated out of Latin into French, & out of French into English. Now newly set foorth, with many places restored and corrected by conferences of sundrie copies. Antwerp: John Fowler, 1573.

link_mentions.page: List of printers in the Southern Netherlands
response: * Widow of John Fowler, active 1579–1586; moved to Douai, active 1586–1602
* John Fowler, active 1565–1574; moved to Douai, active 1577–1578
